In other words, the "View Field Configuration" page should be localisable just like issue type names, priority names etc.

See screen shots.

fields.description:
As indicated in JRA-7309, many users routinely click on links to open in a new window or tab because they don't want to over-write their existing window. The wiki markup help button is another example of that. The shortcut associated with it is the same as the current page, whereas that is no longer the case with the filters and history popups:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/popups/savedfilters.jsp
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/popups/recenthistory.jsp
Users should be able to click on the help in a new window or tab as they are accustomed to.
fields.summary: Wiki Markup help fails to launch unless clicked to open in same window

fields.description:
(n)
I was simply typing a comment in an issue (JRA-8165) that had some characters like underscores or plus signs, as one might do when describing an issue. Unbeknownst to me, these are text effect "tags" in the new wiki markup scheme. That just won't do. If I explain that an error occurs when a user types in {noformat}"_xxx_"{noformat}, I want to see the actual underscores in the issue description, not an italicized version of what's in between them: "_xxx_". HTML tags work because 
1) the tags/codes are not likely to be used in the normal course of typing
2) they are ways to escape them if necessary, but only a programmer would ever need to know how to to that
In what is being presented here within -JIRA-, a casual user would not likely try to figure out how to get around the automatic formatting. It may be unlikely for an issue description to have phrases like noformat, but underscores, dashes, plus signs, and even curly braces are extremely common and are not suitable as tag markers in my opinion. I can easily think of when one might have an issue that gives code snippets like
{ start }
     code
{end}
and these should not present errors.
(n)(n)(n)(n)(n)(n)(n)(n)
fields.summary: WIKI markup doesn't let me over-ride text formatting.

Not sure if this functionality has been fixed, or is indeed intentional, but I thought I'd raise it in case it was an oversight.
Our project's workflow does not allow editing of closed issues. However, when deleting a version, the system told me there was 1 issue to be fixed for that version, and offered me the chance to change the version for that issue. However, it was a closed issue, so I shouldn't really be able to change the version on a closed issue. I wonder if this is intentional so administrators don't get stuck?

fields.description:
When I post a file attachment (e.g., a patch) to an issue, JIRA solicits from me a comment to be added to the issue.

I'd like it to be clearer on later review of the issue that the comment is related to the file attachment.  I'd like the comment to be clearly identified as being a "Comment associated with a file attachment", I'd like it to link to that file attachment.  And then at the top of the issue, where file attachments are summarized, I'd like each file attachment to have a link to its associated comment when present.

This issue in our deployment of JIRA gave rise to this RFE:
https://clearinghouse.ja-sig.org/issues/browse/UP-1253

I posted an attachment and comment, and then there was some confusion by developers who found the issue, read the comment, but didn't see the file attachment, which is too easy to overlook at present.
fields.summary: Link to posted file attachment in comment associated with file attachment

fields.description:
Does Jira delivers an option to retrieve the work logs on a monthly base. Up to now it is possible to review the work logs for each Jira issue.
What we will do is to log all done work to the Jira to work logs. With the entered work logs we have the need to create monthly timesheets for each developers.
Is there a way to retrieve this information to the export function or the supplied API.

If there is no way to treat this issue I would add this as a feature request for further releases.
fields.summary: Read work logs from Jira on a monthly base

fields.description:
We have integrated several different and independent CVS repositories into their corresponding categories/projects.

Recently, one of our CVS repositories had to be moved due to space limitations.  In order to ensure our users were not impacted by this we made the old repository location a symbolic link to the new location.

i.e. For all users the CVSROOT path remained as: ':ext:<username>@<servername>:/var/lib/cvs'
but now  '/var/lib/cvs' is a symbolic link to '/the/new/location/here'. 

Upon doing this, CVS integration broke for all projects, and all CVS repositories (despite the other repositories not being moved). 

Under the version control tab for all projects we were seeing:
An unknown error occurred - actions == null. 

And when testing the configuration we were seeing the error: 

Error obating lock.
com.atlassian.jira.util.LockException: Could not obtain lock '/var/jira/logs/cvslog.write.lock' in 10000 msecs.
at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.updateCvs(CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.java:246)
...

Upon removing the cvslog.write.lock this error disappeared for the other repositories, and it wasn't until I added the aboslute new path to the repository we moved, that things started behaving correctly again.
fields.summary: Integration breaks for all projects when a CVSROOT path is changed to a symbolic link

However, I cannot filter out any issue from the list that is marked with the resolution of "Won't Fix" or "Unreproducible" or "Duplicate", for example.  We do not release these issues (alternatively, if the release notes indicated which issues we wouldn't fix, that would also give important information to our customers.)
fields.summary: Release Notes should track resolution

fields.description:
After creating an issue with the atlassian SOAP Client and updating a custom field of this issue some times, it seems that the relation between the issue and its custom field get lost.
I attached the source of the simple SOAP Client I've used.
I've executed the Client and got the output:
>Running test SOAP client...
>Successfully created issue TST-3762

So I had a look at my result at 
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST-3762?page=all

As you can see the update worked fine the first few times, but then the original value changed to the second updated value, and after that, the original value is empty and the custom field 'Random Text' isn't shown any more in the summary above.

To handle Jira via the SOAP interface it is very important for us, that the update of the custom fields works correctly.
fields.summary: Relation to custom field seems to be disappeared after updating the value of the issue's custom field

fields.description:
Create and Cancel buttons at the bottom make sense. They also make sense to be at the top (center) of the Create Issue page. Above the Project field and below the "Step 2 of 2" text.

Main reason is that if the fields most frequently filled are at the top, they can be filled in and the issue created without having to scroll to the end of the page to hit the Create button. (Assuming there are enough other fields that are presumably optional, that cause the page to be so long that the user would have to scroll to see the buttons. <g>)
fields.summary: Add Create and Cancel buttons to the top (center) of the Create Issue wizard page

fields.description:
When using the Single Level Group by Report (filter + "Assignee"), when an issue is set with a custom resolution (in our case "Patch Created, but not applied"), the report output does not seem to be able to resolve the text name of the custom resolution.

See attached screen shot for more information.  We're about to upgrade to the latest version of JIRA, so not quite sure if it's already fixed or not, but couldn't find anything in the JIRA issues from a few searches.
fields.summary: Single Level Group by Report does not like custom resolutions

fields.description:
The following files need to removed from the respective language packs:
CommentAssignIssue_da_DK.properties
CommentAssignIssue_de_DE.properties
CommentAssignIssue_zh_TW.properties

The inclusion of these causes some pages to display half in that language and half in English.
E.g. German and English.
fields.summary: Remove CommentAssignIssue_*.properties files from all language packs.

fields.description:
Recieve the following error message after power fail:

HTTP Status 404 - /secure/Dashboard.jspa

type Status report

message /secure/Dashboard.jspa

description The requested resource (/secure/Dashboard.jspa) is not available.
Apache Tomcat/5.5.9

fields.description: In Safari, accesskeys are activated using the Ctrl key.
fields.summary: "Create" button tooltip says "Press alt+s to submit form" but alt+s doesn't work in Safari

fields.description:
Prior to upgrading to 3.3.1-#97, I had the ability to use bulk changes to make adjustments to closed issues whose attributes were set incorrectly. Now I cannot.

The specific example is the the "Fixed Version." Sometimes a developer will forget to set this value or set it incorrectly. Since I use this as part of some quality metrics I need to update these fields. I also track "ReOpens" to issues as a quality function of the development process, so while I can reopen an issue to fix the problem, this reduces the meaning of reopen. Since I have full administrative rights, isn't it reasonable that I be able to make this kind change?
fields.summary: Loss of post-close change ability
Current release attribute
Multi Select custom field sorts only on the first selected option.
Update Traditional Chinese pack

fields.description: Was reviewing a full content report of a filter, and realized there were no status fields being displayed.  I see assignee, reporter, resolution.  Could this be added, preferably with the status icon?
fields.summary: Full content view does not show issue status

fields.description: THe instructions are different to the ones for IIS 5.0 that we already have.
fields.summary: Write docs regarding integration with IIS 6 which ships with Windows Server 2003

fields.description:
JIRA should force new CSS / Javascript include to refresh

At the moment, when we upgrade the CSS / javascript, users pretty much have to do a Shift + Reload before everything works properly
fields.summary: JIRA should force new CSS / Javascript include to refresh

fields.description:
In jira-application.properties, there is an option:

jira.search.fullcontentview.pagebreaks=true

which causes CSS to be emitted in the Full Content view to break pages at issue boundaries.  This keeps IE users happy (see JRA-4226), but makes Firefox users unhappy (se JRA-8085).  We should:

a) Investigate what the issue with Firefox is, and if necessary raise a bug with Mozilla
b) Make the option settable in General Configuration, if there is no other option.
fields.summary: Add option to disable CSS pagebreaks in full content view

fields.description:
Running the following script:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<jira:Login username="bob" password="password">
<jira:AttachFile key="ABC-218"
filepath="/home/sccs/build/build_SUP_000093.TEST.20050928090900.log"
option="override"/>
<jira:AddComment comment="Test"
issue-key="ABC-218" commentLevel="jira-users"/>
</jira:Login>
</JiraJelly>

will fail with the following message in the logs:

2005-10-04 10:11:05,675 [webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher] Unable to find 'webwork.multipart.saveDir' property setting. Defaulting to javax.servlet.context.tempdir
2005-10-04 10:12:16,475 ERROR [web.action.util.JellyRunner] Could not run script.
org.apache.commons.jelly.JellyTagException: null:5:0: <jira:AttachFile> Unable to make temporary copy of file.

and rather confusingly, the 'jelly is disabled' message in the browser:


As a security precaution, the Jelly Runner on this installation is currently disabled. To enable Jelly support, please start JIRA with "-Djira.jelly.on=true". For more information see the Jelly Documentation.

It looks like there is some fault in the Jelly runner logic which is throwing up the wrong error page.
fields.summary: Jelly runner shows 'jelly disabled' screen instead of error message

<description>

    <webwork:property value="@issue/description" escape="false"/>
  </jira:text2html>
</description>
fields.summary: XML output contains untranslated tags on Websphere 6 (<jira:text2html> not processed)
Custom field showing how long an issue has been open
Mechanism to control automatic screen refresh on filters.
Show disabled users with striked through names

fields.description: I imported issues for the first time using the CSV importer. It went well, except that I wanted all issues to have the same Reporter, Task, priority, and value for a customfield. I could not see how to do that except to create a new column in the spreadsheet and populate it, which was a manual effort. Is there a way to set these in the configuration file nexttime I need to do this? I realize it is (probably) using the system default for undefined fields, but is there a way to set the default for a particular  import session?
fields.summary: CSV import to default columns?

fields.description:
The saved filters portlet doesn't perform very well in large installations because the issue count is shown for each filter.

If you have a large amount of filters, a count is performed for each filter. This makes the page where the portlet is shown load slower than necessary.

May i suggest that you implement a configuration option on this portlet so that the user can select if the number of issues for a filter should be shown together with the filter name or not.
fields.summary: Implement configuration option on saved filters portlet

fields.description:
I've added Issue Created -> Single e-mail address entry to the project's notification scheme.
But not a single e-mail reaches this address.
fields.summary: Notification is not being sent for a "single email address"

fields.description: I really like the "Clone Issue" operation. The problem with it is that you don't get the opportunity to edit it prior to completing the details. So, the current assignee will get an email about an issue with a description etc. that is about to be changed. What should happen is that when you click on Clone issue, and after you edit the summary, instead of just completing the operation with the Create button, there should be another button that takes you into the standard create issue screen, where you can edit the assignee, description etc. Being able to only change the summary is very restricting. If we added a middle button called "Edit" or something similar, then a user could clone an issue and have all the fields identical to the original but it won't fire off the notification until the description and assignee etc. have been correctly set. Currently, the workaround I have is to assign the original issue to me before I clone it. I hope I've explained myself well enough.
fields.summary: Clone operation should launch create issue page

fields.description:
I've made a custom Validator for workflow transitions that checks that a given field isn't left empty. 
As required, the validate() method of the Validator throws an InvalidInputException when the user leaves the field empty.

Problem: this exceptions is treated as a server error by JIRA and written in the log files and on the console!

Bad user input is not a server error, it is a normal use case... I'd like my validator to behave just like a normal date/time or username validator.

Thanks for any help...
Rémy.
fields.summary: Exception thrown by validate() method of custom Validator handled as a server error

fields.description:
HI,

I have created a permission scheme and assigned it to the projects my group work on.
"Resolve Issue" and "Close Issue" permissions are allowed to specific User Groups.
It seems that these permissions are not taken in account, ie a user appartening to a group not allowed to "Resolve an issue" is in fact allowed to do it !

Apparently, only permissions regarding to "workflow steps" are ignored and proposed to every user who have a "Browse Project" permission.

To Notice: Personal workflows have been created to match the needs of the group, these are not the one proposed by default in Jira.
I have reassigned to one of the project (a test project for Jira) the standard workflow -> Now, the permissions "Resolve" and "Close" are taking in account the permission scheme.

If you need any other information to help you help me (...), do not hesitate.
fields.summary: Workflow Permissions not taken in account

fields.description:
"The new version will be added before the selected version."

I always assume this means chronologically before, but it actually means "before that version in the list" which really means after that version. I'm confused.
fields.summary: Add new version ordering is confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8095].
  {panel}

Hi,

First off, great product and thanks again for the open source licensing for the Australian Biological Information Facility (ABIF) portal project.

It seems that there are two types of links which every installation should use if they use issue linking: duplicates and dependency. I would vote that they are made standard links which every installation has (and are undeletable).

If that was the case, you would be able to more easily build standard functionality on them. Some of this functionality might include:
- Gantt charts, displaying dependencies between issues.
- Dependency change notification (I'll elaborate on that).

I think this is a natural progression in the direction the application is already moving in. It feels like 90% of the work for this kind of stuff is done and the application could soon start creating some of those really awesome bonus features (like Gantt charts).

Dependency change notification: If an issue is marked as "depending" on another, you could set up a default "watch" action. If the issue which was the prerequisite had a status change, JIRA could then send an email to the person assigned to that issue.
fields.summary: Make link types for "Dependency" and "Duplicate" standard

fields.description:
It appears that Axis does not provide any SOAP endpoints when JIRA is run behind https.  When one requests /rpc/soap, eg:

https://support.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/exec sp_prepexec @P1 output, N'@P1 bigint,@P2 bigint,@P3 nvarchar(4000),@P4 nvarchar(4000),@P5 nvarchar(4000),@P6 nvarchar(4000),@P7 datetime,@P8 decimal(38,0)', N'INSERT INTO jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, actionbody, CREATED, actionnum) VALUES (@P1 , @P2 , @P3 , @P4 , @P5 , @P6 , @P7 , @P8 )', 12823, 10549, N'neala', N'comment', NULL, N'The main problem is that ''smart'' quotes are really "dumb" because only MS Word knows about them.', 'Dec 31 2005 1:53:17:257PM', NULL



One gets back:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
"""

instead of the usual:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
          o getUser
          o createUser
          o getComponents
          o createGroup
          o getGroup
          o login
          o getServerInfo
          o updateGroup
"""

The WSDL is correspondingly empty.
fields.summary: SOAP does not work over HTTPS / SSL on certain configurations

The title is there but there is no content.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

We are certainly working to make JIRA more flexible on a per-project basis so that it's easier for a variety of teams to adapt it. Voting and watching certainly fall under this category. While this issue is not currently on our roadmap, we do hope to address this in the future.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  
There should be a project permission to restrict which users can vote or watch for an issue.
fields.summary: Voting and Watching Permission
limit number of links of a certain type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8090].
  {panel}

The getIssuesFromFilter() function returns entire bugs with all history, comments, etc. This is fine on a LAN but over the internet doing simple things like getting a list of the summaries for all bugs assigned to Joe is very slow and bandwidth-consuming.

My suggestion is to modify the function, or provide an overload or new function that lets me customize what will get returned. Perhaps a simple array of field names to return would work. Then I could ignore fields that I don't need anyway that are large to transfer in SOAP.

The brass ring would be to add a "cursor" feature that lets me do a query then iterate through the issues in chunks, rather than getting them all at once in a big pile (similar to how the issue navigator lets me go a page at a time).


Original email conversation follows:

Hi Scott,

 > I admit the "count" feature is something that is too specific to be
 > useful to a lot of people. So instead of returning counts, what about
 > accepting more arguments in getIssuesFromFilter() that let us choose
 > which fields are returned? Returning them all as it does now is very
 > painful when using Jira from remote.

I can see that this will be useful. You are more than welcome to create 
a new feature request on http://jira.atalssian.com. Please note however 
that it might take us some time to get to this feature as we have *a 
lot* of  feature requests. The way we implement new features and 
improvements is described here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Implementation+of+New+Features+and+Improvements

 > How does Confluence do this btw for its macros that show the top 10
 > issues? As far as I know, Conf talks to Jira via an RPC method. If a
 > filter has 200 items in it, does Conf end up downloading all 200 items
 > in full, just to show the summaries and bug numbers for 10 of

Confluence HTML grabs (sort of "screen grabs") the results of a JIRA 
portlet from JIRA by posting ot the RunPortlet URL. For example:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RunPortlet.jspa?portletKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.portlets:filterstats&filterid=12265&statistictype=assignees&

The URL for each portlet can be obtained by turning "Configure" on, on 
the dashboard and looking at link of portlet's name.

Alternatively Confluence fetches the RSS view of a filter from JIRA and 
then displays it:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/navigatorviews.html

Thanks,
Anton


Scott Bilas wrote:
> I admit the "count" feature is something that is too specific to be
> useful to a lot of people. So instead of returning counts, what about
> accepting more arguments in getIssuesFromFilter() that let us choose
> which fields are returned? Returning them all as it does now is very
> painful when using Jira from remote.
> 
> How does Confluence do this btw for its macros that show the top 10
> issues? As far as I know, Conf talks to Jira via an RPC method. If a
> filter has 200 items in it, does Conf end up downloading all 200 items
> in full, just to show the summaries and bug numbers for 10 of them?
> 
> Scott
> 
> 
> Nick Menere <mailto:nick.menere@atlassian.com> wrote on Monday,
> September 05, 2005 11:15 PM:
> 
> 
>>Hi Scott,
>>
>>Our SOAP interface doesn't really support anything like that.  Though
>>it is possible to extend the SOAP interface using the XML/RPC pugin:
>>http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/RPC+Endpoint+Plug
>>in+Module 
>>
>>You also have access to our source if you wish to make modifications
>>to the current methods.
>>
>>Cheers,
>>Nick
>>
>>
>>
>>Scott Bilas wrote:
>>
>>>Hi there,
>>>
>>>I'm trying to use Jira's SOAP API to gather current statistics on the
>>>database, similar to how the portlets work, except to post the data
>>>in a different place. Unfortunately getIssues returns all the data
>>>for each bug, where I pretty much just want counts of the number of
>>>elements in a query, or the short summaries of each bug (not the
>>>full description with comments, etc.). Is there a way to get this
>>>information from Jira's SOAP API? 
>>>
>>>Scott
> 
>
fields.summary: Request to customize returns from getIssuesFromFilter() RPC

fields.description:
Dear JIRA Support,

-----
We want to develop the following plugin:
Workflow transition Validator that checks the value of a field.

Surprisingly, the standard Validators (PermissionValidators) that come along with JIRA and that are documented in the API Javadoc Documentation do not implement interface com.opensymphony.workflow.Validator. Are they somehow "wrapped" by JIRA-Classes? I need to overload the methods that pass the parameters to and from the .vm scripts: where are they?
-----

Kind regards,
Thomas Lingenfelder

fields.description:
The <jira:AttachFile> tag needs a temporary copy of the attachment. Unfortunately it tries to create it in the same directory that the attachment came from.  So if you're trying to attach /foo/somefile.txt, JIRA tries to create /foo/tmp/somefile.txt (and delete it afterwards).

This is clearly a bad idea, since the attachment directory may not be writeable.
fields.summary: Jelly AttachFile tag needs write access to source attachments directory

When I try to print the "full content" our printer stops after the first page, sometimes cutting of the last line.

Fiefox has a "printing preview". the preview shows only one page, too.

Explorer and Opera works fine, i tried two different laser-printer, i checked windows 2000 and XP
fields.summary: Printing "Full Content" with Firefox 1.07 stops after first page

fields.description:
From email
----------------------
I'm working on a project and we'd like to more neatly integrate the 
application with our JIRA setup.  We're attempting to use SOAP calls, 
but looking through the API I'm not finding everything we're looking 
for.  We're trying to retrieve the groups that a user belongs to, but 
I can't seem to find something that will retrieve them.  Failing that, 
I thought of the other approach of matching them via retrieving the 
users belonging to each particular group, but I can't find a function 
to retrieve all the groups.
fields.summary: SOAP should be able to find out what groups a user is a member of

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8081].
  {panel}

{panel:title=22nd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. There a couple add-ons on the Atlassian Marketplace that can support this, such as [Configuration Manager for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.botronsoft.jira.configurationmanager]. Alternatively, this is very easy to do with a simple GET of the component you want to copy and a POST of the components JSON representation to the JIRA REST API, simply change the project key and id in the rep.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

This issue is related to JRE-501 (Shared Components) and JRE-6999 (Add ability to export/import projects):

We need a way to copy components from one project to another. This is because the projects have _nearly_ the same components.

There are several ways how this issue might be solved from my point of view:

1. There might be an ex- and import of project-components.
2. There might be a button in the Projects-Administration to copy a project.
3. Upon creation of a new project you are asked if to take components from an existing project (and perhaps other settings, too)

Now the reason why we require this:

In contrast to perhaps the normal application-development we had to create projects for each release-version of the same application. This is because after a version is released it will go into maintenance-mode thus the version is never really finished. See for example a release history like this:

January V 1.0 build 1 Final-Release (Components: A, B, C)
February V 1.1 build 1 Final-Release (Components: A, C)
March V 1.0 build 2 Bugfix-Release
April V2.0 build 1 Final-Release  (Components: A, C, D)
May V1.1 build 2 Bugfix-Release

and so on. Therefore virtually we have a new project/product with every Final-Release. It's rather hard to mirror this pre-existing handling of versions inside JIRA as the "normal" version-concept included into JIRA does not fit. So the application-versions are now projects while the JIRA-version-field is related to the build-numbers.

To use our workaround we now have to copy all components from one project to another. Resolving this issue would ease to handle this workaround.
fields.summary: Add a feature to copy/paste components between projects

fields.description: If the CSV importer fails halfway during an import (eg. due to invalid CSV), you have a problem. Half your .csv file is imported, and rerunning the importer on the same .csv will duplicate the already-imported issues. It would be nice if the importer had the option of ignoring issues it has already imported (eg. by checking the summary+type+project).
fields.summary: CSV importer should have option to ignore already imported issues

fields.description:
Jira currentl redirects the action from update workflow to update fields through the server. As a result the incorrect action is used for the client.

The problem only arises when the user needs to change the status of the issue.
fields.summary: Move Issue redirects on the server instead of on the client

fields.description:
Currently there are problems that people have when using the standalone that are possible to detect ahead of time:

(a) Detect if something is using the web port '8080', and prevent the server from starting, and print out an error message
(b) fix up the logging from Tomcat - the screen should say 'starting', and then only the logs that are necessary should be printed out
-(c) Detect JDK requirements - if we need the JDK, check that they aren't using the JRE instead- _\[edit: we don't require JDK now\]_
(d) JAVA_HOME not pointing correctly.  Whilst I think that the Tomcat script currently does this - we can improve the error messages
(e) Create a link to our support page for installing, should they have any problems
fields.summary: Startup script for standalone should detect common errors.
Add ability to specify the default component in the CreateOrCommentHandler

fields.description:
In "Global permissions:"  admin screen default option is to give admin right to anyone including not logged in users (see attach). So if admin accidentally presses enter he can create huge security hole without even noticing. (happened almost for real with me.)

Sorry for bad english.

fields.description: In the support request admin page, we currently provide a text field for specifying a path to the logs. Since we know the log location (the current directory plus 'atlassian-jira.log'), we should hardcode this path, and make the option a checkbox (checked by default).  The logs should also be zipped automatically.
fields.summary: Support Request page should include logs by default
